item.title: 9 reasons to eat persimmon fruit in winter - The Times of India
item.description:
9 reasons to eat persimmon fruit in winter

Publication Date: Jan 7, 2025 | Source: Times Of India

Persimmons are a superfruit highly beneficial during the winter season. They are packed with essential nutrients that promote health and well-being, making them an ideal winter food.

  • Enhances immunity
  • Packed with antioxidants
  • Supports heart health
  • Keeps you energized
  • Very rich in fiber for weight loss
  • Helps with blood pressure regulations
  • Improves skin health
  • Supports digestion
  • Boosts immunity
  • Improves eye health
“Persimmons abound with vitamin A content and can enhance immunity while reducing the chances of winter illnesses.”

Incorporating persimmons into your winter diet can lead to numerous health benefits.

item.title: ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
item.description:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.

item.title: Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection - The Hindu
item.description:
Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection

Date: January 07, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Health Minister Veena George reassured the public that there is no need for panic regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that most circulating information is false and that the virus has been previously detected in the state.

  • George reported that the Institute of Advanced Virology has detected 11 cases of HMPV in 2023 and 2024.
  • She advised precautions for vulnerable populations including those with low immunity, pregnant women, and the elderly.
  • The Minister emphasized wearing masks in crowded areas but noted no travel restrictions are in place.
  • George inaugurated various development projects at Thrissur Government Medical College Hospital, including a substation and new health facilities.
  • The Minister also launched renovations at the Mundathikode Family Health Centre.
“The claim that it is being reported for the first time in the country is completely false.” - Veena George

The public is encouraged to remain calm and informed as health authorities monitor the situation closely.

item.title: Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung announces date for Galaxy S25 series, opens pre-reserve - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Galaxy Unpacked 2025: Samsung announces date for Galaxy S25 series, opens pre-reserve

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

Samsung has officially announced that the much-anticipated Galaxy S25 series will be revealed on January 22, 2025, during its Galaxy Unpacked event in San Jose, California.

  • Pre-reservations for the Galaxy S25 series are already open in India for a token payment of ₹2,000.
  • Early birds can avail of benefits worth up to ₹5,000.
  • The series is expected to include four models: Galaxy S25, S25+, S25 Ultra, and Galaxy S25 Slim.
  • The Galaxy S25 Slim is said to have a 6.7-inch QHD+ AMOLED screen, Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and a 200MP main camera.
  • Samsung may also unveil an Android XR-based headset during the event.
“If past trends are anything to go by, the Galaxy S25 series could hit stores by February 7.”

The excitement for the Galaxy S25 series is building as Samsung prepares to redefine the smartphone experience once again.

item.title: Salman Khan Gets His Balcony Covered With Bullet Proof Glass Amid Threats; Video Goes Viral - News18
item.description:
Salman Khan Gets His Balcony Covered With Bullet Proof Glass Amid Threats; Video Goes Viral

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: News18

Salman Khan has upgraded security at his Mumbai residence amid ongoing threats to his life. His balcony is now protected by bullet proof glass following previous gunfire incidents linked to a local gang.

  • Recent threats associated with jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi’s gang.
  • Gunshots fired outside Khan’s residence in April 2024, leading to increased security measures.
  • The gang demanded Rs 5 crore for Salman’s safety, threatening severe repercussions.
  • Khan has enhanced personal security including a bulletproof SUV and additional armed officers.
  • Upcoming film release, 'Sikandar', planned for Eid 2025.
“If the demand wasn’t met, he would suffer a fate worse than Baba Siddique.”

This increase in security reflects the serious nature of threats against Salman Khan, indicating a concerning shift in his public safety.

item.title: Disquiet within BJP over Delhi poll ticket to Ramesh Bidhuri, talks held on ‘shifting, if not cancelling’ candidature - The Indian Express
item.description:
Disquiet within BJP over Delhi poll ticket to Ramesh Bidhuri, talks held on ‘shifting, if not cancelling’ candidature

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Indian Express

Ramesh Bidhuri, a BJP leader, faces backlash following derogatory remarks about rivals while campaigning for the Delhi Assembly elections, raising questions about his candidacy.

  • Bidhuri made controversial comments about Delhi Chief Minister Atishi during a recent campaign.
  • His remarks have led to internal party discussions regarding the potential replacement of his candidacy.
  • Despite backlash, Bidhuri has a notable political history, being a two-time Lok Sabha MP and three-time MLA.
“My intention was not to insult anyone. But still, if anyone has been hurt then I express my regret.” - Ramesh Bidhuri

The BJP is considering various options for a potential candidate replacement, amidst a growing narrative against Bidhuri's candidacy from the opposition.

item.title: Aamir Khan takes 'Mannat' to quit smoking if Junaid Khan’s film 'Loveyapa' gets its success - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Aamir Khan's Promise to Quit Smoking for Son Junaid's Film Success

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Aamir Khan has vowed to quit smoking if his son Junaid Khan’s upcoming romantic comedy 'Loveyapa' becomes a success. The film is generating buzz, and Aamir's commitment showcases his support for Junaid.

  • Junaid Khan is set to star in 'Loveyapa' alongside Khushi Kapoor.
  • The romantic comedy features themes relevant to modern life, including technology's impact on relationships.
  • Aamir Khan praised the performances in the film and likened Khushi's energy to her mother, Sridevi.
  • 'Loveyapa' will release in theaters on February 7, 2025.
Aamir Khan on the film: "I liked this film, it is very entertaining... All the actors have done a good job."

Overall, Aamir Khan's gesture not only highlights his bond with his son but also generates interest in 'Loveyapa', setting it up as a potential box-office success.

item.title: More breast cancer cases found when AI used in screenings, study finds - The Guardian
item.description:
More breast cancer cases found when AI used in screenings, study finds

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: The Guardian

This article discusses a study revealing that the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in breast cancer screenings significantly improves detection rates without increasing false positives.

  • The study analyzed data from 461,818 women in a national breast cancer screening program in Germany.
  • AI was used in the screening of 260,739 women, resulting in a 6.7% increase in cancer detection rates.
  • The AI tool provides “safety net” alerts for potentially suspicious scans that may have been overlooked.
  • A total of 2,881 women were diagnosed with breast cancer; the adjusted detection rate rose to 17.6% higher in the AI group.
  • Important considerations were raised regarding the implications of detecting more in situ cancers.
“We could improve the detection rate without increasing the harm for the women taking part in breast cancer screening,” - Prof Alexander Katalinic

The study highlights the potential for AI technology to enhance breast cancer detection, but underscores the need for cautious integration into existing healthcare systems.

item.title: Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system

Published on: Tue, Jan 7, 2025, 02:01 PM

Bangladesh batter Mominul Haque expressed his frustration over the proposed two-tier Test structure that could devalue the longer format of the game in Bangladesh.

  • Reports suggest the 'Big Three' (India, Australia, England) are in discussions to implement a two-division Test cricket structure.
  • The proposed system would be introduced after the current Future Tours Program ends in 2027.
  • Mominul is concerned about the potential reduction in the number of Test matches and the implications for player development.
  • The International Cricket Council is set to discuss the proposal with representatives from Australia and England.
  • Mominul emphasizes that playing against stronger teams is critical for the growth and improvement of Test cricket.
“It's frustrating for me. I am not sure whether we can progress to the first tier if we play well in the second tier... The value of Test cricket will go down if this happens.” - Mominul Haque

The conversation surrounding the two-tier system continues to raise concerns about the future of Test cricket and its impact on player development and the game's overall value.

item.title: Ajith Kumar crashes race car into barrier ahead of 24H Dubai 2025. Watch video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajith Kumar's Race Car Crash Ahead of 24H Dubai 2025

Publication Date: Jan 07, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Ajith Kumar returned to racing after over a decade and faced an incident during a practice run for the 24H Dubai 2025, losing control of his car but fortunately escaping unhurt.

  • Ajith crashed his race car into a barrier during a practice session.
  • The crash occurred around 12:45 PM local time.
  • His team confirmed that he was unharmed and immediately switched to another car to continue practice.
  • Ajith Kumar owns a racing team called Ajith Kumar Racing.
  • The 24H Dubai 2025 is scheduled for January 11-12.
“Yes, he narrowly escaped an accident… Ajith shifted to another race car because this one was totalled and continued practice. Thankfully, he is unharmed.” – Ajith's team

This incident underscores Ajith's return to competitive racing and his dedication to the sport after a long hiatus.

item.title: Lunar Temperature Fluctuations: Understanding the Moon's Extreme Conditions - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Lunar Temperature Fluctuations: Understanding the Moon's Extreme Conditions

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

The surface temperature of the moon experiences extreme variations, making it one of the harshest environments in the solar system.

  • During lunar daylight, temperatures can exceed 100 degrees Celsius.
  • In the absence of an atmosphere, lunar temperatures can drop to minus 100 degrees Celsius at night.
  • The moon's regolith significantly influences these temperature shifts.
  • Shaded areas within lunar pits maintain a steady temperature of 17 degrees Celsius, suggesting potential for human habitation.
  • Permanently shadowed craters at the lunar poles may host temperatures as low as minus 248.15 degrees Celsius.
Understanding the moon's thermal dynamics is essential for designing equipment capable of withstanding its conditions.

The extreme temperatures on the moon highlight the challenges of future lunar exploration and potential settlements.

item.title: Justin Trudeau's ‘one regret’ as he steps down as Canada PM: Here's what he said - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Justin Trudeau Announces Resignation as Canada PM, Reflects on Tenure

Date: Monday, October 9, 2023 Source: Hindustan Times

On Monday, Justin Trudeau announced his resignation as Prime Minister of Canada, marking the end of his nine-year tenure. He emphasized the need for Canadians to have a 'real choice' in the next election.

  • Trudeau's leadership has faced challenges with public discontent over rising prices and housing shortages.
  • He expressed regret over not reforming Canada's electoral system to allow more voting choices.
  • The Liberal Party will choose a new leader through a nationwide process.
  • Trudeau reflected that he cannot lead if he is engaged in internal party battles.
"If I have one regret... I do wish we’d been able to change the way we elect our governments." - Justin Trudeau

Trudeau aims to support the new leader in carrying forward the Liberal Party ideals as they prepare for the upcoming election.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Box Office: 20 Minutes Of Additional Footage But 3 Records That May Still Remain Unbeaten By Allu Arjun’s 1700 Crore+ Blockbuster! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office: 20 Minutes Of Additional Footage But 3 Records That May Still Remain Unbeaten

Publication Date: December 5, 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2: The Rule has smashed box office records yet faces challenges in achieving three key milestones. After five weeks, it has grossed ₹1748.28 crores worldwide, but it may not surpass certain records.

  • Top record highlights exclude:
  • Highest Tollywood grosser in North America with current earnings of $15.04 million.
  • Highest worldwide grosser, unable to surpass Dangal’s lifetime collection of ₹2059.04 crores.
  • While returning a profit margin of 147%, it still trails behind other profitable films.
“Pushpa 2 has seen massive profits despite its hurdles in the box office run.”

Overall, while the film has set numerous records, it continues to compete fiercely in the cinematic landscape.

item.title: India FY25 GDP growth seen at four-year low of 6.4% on weak manufacturing, sluggish investment - The Indian Express
item.description:
India's GDP Growth at 4-Year Low of 6.4% Amid Weak Manufacturing and Investment

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

India’s GDP is projected to grow at 6.4% in FY25, marking a four-year low, largely due to weak industrial and investment growth as per the first advance estimates released by the National Statistics Office.

  • GDP growth for FY25 lower than Reserve Bank of India estimate (6.6%) and government estimate (6.5-7%).
  • Strong slowdown in primary and secondary sectors with exceptions in agriculture.
  • Manufacturing GVA growth expected to decline to 5.3% from 9.9% in FY24.
  • Private final consumption expenditure is expected to rise significantly to 7.3% in FY25.
  • Government final consumption expenditure expected to grow at 4.1%, an increase from 2.5% in the previous year.
“The lower GDP growth for FY25 has been the result of a cyclical slowdown in the Indian economy in the past three quarters.” - Paras Jasrai, Senior Economic Analyst, India Ratings and Research

This decline indicates potential challenges ahead for the Indian economy, with implications for future fiscal and monetary policies.

item.title: 'Immensely touched': Sharmistha thanks PM Modi after govt earmarks land for memorial of ex-president Pran - The Times of India
item.description:
Sharmistha Thanks PM Modi for Earmarking Land for Pranab Mukherjee's Memorial

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Sharmistha Mukherjee expressed her gratitude to Prime Minister Modi after the government designated a plot of land for a memorial dedicated to her late father, former President Pranab Mukherjee.

  • The government of India has officially earmarked land for the memorial.
  • Sharmistha highlighted the importance of her father’s contributions to the country.
  • She conveyed her heartfelt thanks to PM Modi for this gesture.
"I am immensely touched by this honor. My father dedicated his life to India." - Sharmistha Mukherjee

This memorial will serve as a tribute to Pranab Mukherjee's legacy and contributions.
